intro: Adenophorus tripinnatifidus, commonly known as the three-parted adenophorus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, tripinnatifid leaves that give it a feathery appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and ecology.
